currentPositions.description: Leading the Functional Biocharacterization & Impurities group, a team of 12+ dedicated and passionate scientists, who focus on developing analytical methods in potency, bioassays, and impurities assays. The team is focused on understanding regulatory and CMC requirements to advance, approve, and validate lower cost biotherapeutics. I also lead analytical and process efforts to support CMC strategy for diverse biologics formats such as biosimilars, monoclonal antibodies, Fc fusion proteins, and bispecifics.
currentPositions.title: Group Lead, Principal Scientist of Functional Biocharacterization and Impurities

headline: Group Lead of Functional Biocharacterization and Impurities | Analytical and Process Development | Potency and Impurities Assays | CMC Strategy

publications.description: Arp2/3 is a protein complex that nucleates actin filament assembly in the lamellipodium in adherent cells crawling on planar 2-dimensional (2D) substrates. However, in physiopathological situations, cell migration typically occurs within a 3-dimensional (3D) environment, and little is known about the role of Arp2/3 and associated proteins in 3D cell migration. Using time resolved live-cell imaging and HT1080, a fibrosarcoma cell line commonly used to study cell migration, we find that the Arp2/3 complex and associated proteins N-WASP, WAVE1, cortactin, and Cdc42 regulate 3D cell migration. We report that this regulation is caused by formation of multigeneration dendritic protrusions, which mediate traction forces on the surrounding matrix and effective cell migration. The primary protrusions emanating directly from the cell body and prolonging the nucleus forms independent of Arp2/3 and dependent on focal adhesion proteins FAK, talin, and p130Cas. The Arp2/3 complex, N-WASP, WAVE1, cortactin, and Cdc42 regulate the secondary protrusions branching off from the primary protrusions. In 3D matrices, fibrosarcoma cells as well as migrating breast, pancreatic, and prostate cancer cells do not display lamellipodial structures. This study characterizes the unique topology of protrusions made by cells in a 3D matrix and show that these dendritic protrusions play a critical role in 3D cell motility and matrix deformation. The relative contribution of these proteins to 3D migration is significantly different from their role in 2D migration.
publications.name: The Arp2/3 complex mediates multigeneration dendritic protrusions for efficient 3-dimensional cancer cell migration
Membrane and actin tethering transitions help IQGAP1 coordinate GTPase and lipid messenger signaling
